statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 2 \\ -4 \\ 12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 15 \\ -3 \\ 24 \\ -42 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 0 \\ -3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 2 \\ -4 \\ 12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 15 \\ -3 \\ 24 \\ -42 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
